column2: TEXAS DMV WRITTEN TEST
Question Text
column10: Answer4 Text

column2: 1. When changing lanes, you should not:
column4: check your side and rear view mirrors.
column6: use the inside rearview mirror to check for blind spots
column10: check to see if other drivers are moving into the same lane.

column2: 2. Doing all you can to prevent crashes is called:
column10: Crash-Prevention Driving

column2: 3. This road sign means:
column8: Bicycles have the same rights as other vehicles
column10: Bicycles cross or ride beside traffic

column2: 4. This sign indicates that the road ahead:
column10: curves right, then left.

column2: 5. This sign means:
column4: Left turns are not allowed at the intersection.
column6: The road will curve to the right.
column10: Winding road ahead.

column2: 6. Road signs that direct drivers to services are:
column10: green and white.

column2: 7. Aggressive driving includes:
column4: quick lane changes without a signal.
column10: yelling, honking, gesturing at other drivers.

column2: 8. At a stop sign there is no stop line, you must stop:
column10: before the traffic light turns red.

column2: 9. This road sign means:
column10: You may turn right after yielding the right-of-way to oncoming traffic

column2: 10. This road sign means:
column6: All traffic must go straight ahead
column10: Side Road

column2: 11. What does a flashing red light mean?
column4: Drivers may move forward with caution.
column10: The same thing as a stop sign.

column2: 12. Diamond-shaped signs:
column8: are used to warn of hazards on roadways.
column10: All of the above.

column2: 13. If your gas pedal is stuck, you should:
column4: try pumping it to increase pressure.
column6: turn off the ignition if your vehicle has power steering.
column8: ease your foot off the gas pedal and brake gently.
column10: hook your shoe under the pedal and see if you can free it. If not, shift into neutral and use the brake to slow your vehicle and get off the road.

column2: 14. __________ limit(s) your concentration, perception, judgment, and memory.
column6: Only a blood alcohol level greater than .05
column8: Only a blood alcohol level greater than the legal limit
column10: Even the smallest amount of alcohol

column2: 15. If another car has stopped in an adjacent lane in the same direction of travel, you should:
column4: tap your horn to let the other driver know you are passing.
column6: be careful in case the other vehicle has stopped for a pedestrian.
column8: pass the car on the left.
column10: speed up and pass the vehicle on the right.

column2: 16. Highway hypnosis is a driving condition that can result from:
column8: staring at the roadway for long periods of time.
column10: heavy traffic.

column2: 17. What should you do if one of your tires blows out?
column4: Decrease speed, pull over to the right and sound your horn to warn the other vehicles.
column8: Hold the steering wheel tight and brake immediately to avoid the risk of skidding.
column10: Hold the steering wheel tight and slowly take your foot off the gas pedal.

column2: 18. You should increase your following distance when:
column4: driving behind a large vehicle that blocks your vision.
column10: All of the above.

column2: 19. The minimum drinking age in this State is ____ years.
20. This sign warns drivers that:
column4: there is a double curve ahead.
column6: the highway ahead is divided into two one-way roadways. Drivers should keep to the right.
column8: there is a low place in the road.
column10: there is a winding road ahead.

column2: 21. This sign means:
column10: Warning: sharp left turn ahead.

column2: 22. This road sign means:
column4: You may proceed only if the way is clear
column6: You are about to enter a one-way street the wrong way
column10: Do not pass

column2: 23. When an aggressive driver confronts you, you should:
column6: Report aggressive drivers to law enforcement authorities.
column10: All of the above.

column2: 24. The octagonal shape is used:
column6: to warn drivers of existing or possible hazards on roadways.
column8: for stop signs and railroad advance warning signs.
column10: exclusively for stop signs.

column2: 25. When driving in icy or snowy conditions, to avoid crashes drivers should:
column4: add extra weight to the vehicle to improve traction.
column6: engage 4 wheel drive on the vehicle.
column8: get off the highway as quickly as possible.
column10: reduce speed and increase following distance.

column2: 26. A flashing red traffic light:
column4: is used to indicate a pedestrian crossing.
column6: has the same meaning as a yield sign.
column8: indicates that you should drive with caution.
column10: has the same meaning as a stop sign.

column2: 27. To drive defensively, you must:
column4: not check behind you through your mirrors.
column8: use only one hand on the wheel.
column10: assume that a driver who approaches a STOP sign on a side road is actually going to stop.

column2: 28. When driving at night, you should slow down and:
column4: use high beams whenever possible, but never when there's oncoming traffic.
column6: use high beams until other drivers dim their lights.
column8: come to a complete stop whenever there's oncoming traffic.
column10: follow the vehicle ahead more closelyÂ to avoid glare from oncoming headlights.

column2: 29. When a hazard is seen ahead, reaction distance:
column4: is how far a vehicle will continue to travel, in ideal conditions, before the driver hits the brakes.
column6: equals total stopping distance minus perception distance.
column8: is the sum of perception distance and braking distance.
column10: None of the above.

column2: 30. When following a motorcycle, drivers must remember that motorcycles can ____________ than other vehicles.
column10: stop much more slowly
